intro: Hafunia globifera, commonly known as the globe-shaped fig, is a unique tropical plant characterized by its distinctive spherical fruits. The plant belongs to the Moraceae family and is native to certain regions of Africa. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while the fruits develop in clusters. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, often hidden within the foliage. Due to its unusual appearance and limited distribution, Hafunia globifera is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
